data.title: Solar Battery Forecast
data.solution:
battery = 0  # Start with an empty battery
max_charge = -1  # Keep track of the maximum charge reached

q = int(input())
n = int(input())
for i in input().split():
    v = int(i)
    battery += v

    if battery <= 0:
        print("Power Outage")  # Handle negative battery case
        max_charge=-1
        break
    
    if battery > q:
        print("Storage Exceeded")  # Capacity exceeded
        max_charge=-1
        break
    
    # Update the maximum charge
    max_charge = max(max_charge, battery)

if max_charge>0:
    print(max_charge)
data.statement:
Welcome to your off-the-grid eco-friendly smart home!
Your house is powered by solar panels that charge a battery, and the energy stored in this battery is used to power your home during cloudy days. The battery has a maximum capacity [[Q]], and you’ve just received a weather forecast predicting the energy changes for the next [[N]] days.

Some days, your solar panels will generate energy (positive values ), while on other days, you’ll consume energy from the battery (negative values ). However, there’s a catch:

If the battery overflows (goes above [[Q]]), the system shuts down.
If the battery runs empty (drops below 0), your home experiences a power outage.

Your task is to determine:

If your battery overflows, print {{Storage Exceeded}}.
If your battery runs empty, print {{Power Outage}}.
Otherwise, print the maximum charge level reached during the [[N]] days.

testCases.title: The power of too much sunshine
The power of too much sunshine

data.outputDescription:
If the battery exceeds [[Q]] : Print {{Storage Exceeded}}.
If the battery drops below 0: Print {{Power Outage}}.
Otherwise: Print the maximum charge level reached during the simulation.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Welcome to your off-the-grid eco-friendly smart home!
Your house is powered by solar panels that charge a battery, and the energy stored in this battery is used to power your home during cloudy days. The battery has a maximum capacity Q, and you’ve just received a weather forecast predicting the energy changes for the next N days.

Some days, your solar panels will generate energy (positive values ), while on other days, you’ll consume energy from the battery (negative values ). However, there’s a catch:

If the battery overflows (goes above Q), the system shuts down.
If the battery runs empty (drops below 0), your home experiences a power outage.

Your task is to determine:

If your battery overflows, print Storage Exceeded.
If your battery runs empty, print Power Outage.
Otherwise, print the maximum charge level reached during the N days.
Input
Line 1: the maximum capacity Q(integer) of the battery
Line 2: the number of days N(integer) in the forecast.
Line 3: A list of N space-separated integers representing the daily energy variations.
Output
If the battery exceeds Q : Print Storage Exceeded.
If the battery drops below 0: Print Power Outage.
Otherwise: Print the maximum charge level reached during the simulation.
Constraints
1≤Q≤1000
1≤N≤100
−100≤variation≤100
Example
Input
10
5
3 -5 4 7 -2
Output
Power Outage
